reviewText: This movie parodies old westerns and is packed with laughs! Pop some corn, open a brew or two and relax.
This movie is delightfully funny with tongue in cheek humor!!  It is a spoof of Classic Westerns like Roy Rogers and Gene Autry. A must have for your DVD Library!
I can't honestly give a review, as I bought it for a friend who wanted it,  gave it to them as soon as it arrived.
My husband would not stop talking about " Rustlers Rhapsody "till I bought it. Now allI do is tell my friends.

It took me forever to find out what comprises the "2 discs" in this set. You get the basic Rustlers' Rhapsody on disc one, but the 2nd disc is an "I Love 80's Music" CD. Now, I was all excited fantasizing what kind of extras we'd get from this great little movie: Rex O'Herlihan(Tom Berenger) before & after the root kicked in? Col. Ticonderoga(Andy Griffith) and his ranchhands having a gabfest, outtakes of the Colonel's daughter(Sela Ward) and Blackie doing "everything", fashion tips from Bob Barber (Patrick Wayne), possibly Peter the Town Drunk finally punching out the sheepherder's wife, or maybe the town doctor presenting a paper to the CDC about what caused the sudden outbreak of a mysterious disease that caused holes to appear in people's gun hands.....instead of fun stuff like these, the buyer will get a CD of 80's music....whoopee..."Dude", the 80's also included Michael Bolton....Tiffany...hell, even Jacobo Mugatu and Uli Kunkel's band Autobahn put out mierda in the 80's. Thanks, but no thanks. Give me a plain old Rustlers' Rhapsody, and warm glass of gin with a human hair.
A great western comedy full of great stars at their funniest. A must see for all who appreciate the old singing cowboy movies.
So pleased receiving it.  Came in good condition.  Would purchase other items from vendor.

This movie is the Airplane of Western Movies.
The cast is excellent and it's a constant
stream of laughts.
